Feat.Name: No Selection
Feat.Description: Clears the current feat selection

Feat.Name: Abundant Step
Feat.Description: You are able to leap through the air to bring the fight to your enemies or traverse chasms that make normal adventurers balk.

Feat.Name: AC Bonus: Wisdom
Feat.Description: Your training improves your armor class, so long as you remain centered. Add your Wisdom bonus to your AC.

Feat.Name: AC Bonus
Feat.Description: Your training improves your armor class, so long as you remain centered You gain a set amount of AC based on your Monk level: Monk 2: 3 AC, Monk 5: 6 AC, Monk 10: 9 AC, Monk 15: 12 AC, Monk 20: 15 AC

Feat.Name: Acrobatic
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to your Jump and Tumble skills.

Feat.Name: Adamantine Body
Feat.Description: Docents you equip provide armor equivalent to Full Plate. This is treated as metallic heavy armor. You have damage reduction 2/Adamantine, a 35% arcane spell failure chance, -5 armor check penalty to certain skills and a +1 maximum dexterity bonus.

Feat.Name: Adept of Forms
Feat.Description: You continue on the path to enlightenment, improving your elemental stances and learning new elemental strikes. Adept of Flame: Sun Stance now grants +2 Strength at a cost of -2 Wisdom. While in Sun Stance you gain 'Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.' and 'Critical Effect: Gain 3 Ki.' Adept of Rain: Ocean Stance now grants +2 Wisdom, +6% dodge, +4 Maximum Dodge, and +3 to all Saving Throws at a cost of -2 Strength. Adept of Rock: Mountain Stance now grants +2 Constitution, a 10% boost to AC, 8 physical resistance and a +40% Insight bonus to melee threat generation, at the cost of -2 Dexterity and -10% movement speed. While in Mountain Stance, you gain 'Get Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.' Adept of Wind: Wind Stance now grants +2 Dexterity, a 10% Enhancement bonus to melee and thrown attack speed and grants a 6% chance to doublestrike with melee weapons, at the cost of -2 Constitution.

Feat.Name: Alertness
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to your Listen and Spot skills.

Feat.Name: Aligning The Heavens
Feat.Description: Water:Light:Water Finisher Activate this finisher to cleanse the local area of anything that might make spellcasting difficult, reducing the spell point costs of all nearby allies by 25% for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Artificer Construct Mastery
Feat.Description: Artificers can spontaneously cast any single target Repair Damage or Inflict Damage spells they have inscribed in their spellbook. These spells will appear in bonus spell slots once inscribed.

Feat.Name: Artificer Craft Mastery
Feat.Description: Artificers are the most skilled crafters in Eberron. Each copy of this feat grants a +1 bonus to crafting level.

Feat.Name: Artificer Knowledge: Arms and Armor
Feat.Description: You have an instinctive understanding of magic items due to your extensive study of them. You gain a +2 bonus to Use Magic Device checks when using armes and armor and their Caster Level is increased by one. This caster level bonus increases by one at levels 8, 11, 14 and 17 and is capped by your Intelligence bonus.

Feat.Name: Artificer Knowledge: Potions
Feat.Description: You have an instinctive understanding of magic items due to your extensive study of them. You gain a +2 bonus to Use Magic Device checks when using potions, and their Caster Level is increased by one. This caster level bonus increases by one at levels 5, 8, 11 and 14 and is capped by your Intelligence Bonus.

Feat.Name: Artificer Knowledge: Scrolls
Feat.Description: You have an instinctive understanding of magic items due to your extensive study of them. You gain a +2 bonus to Use Magic Device checks when using scrolls, and their Caster Level is increased by one. This caster level bonus increases by one at levels 4, 7, 10 and 13 and is capped by your Intelligence Bonus.

Feat.Name: Artificer Knowledge: Wands
Feat.Description: You have an instinctive understanding of magic items due to your extensive study of them. You gain a +2 bonus to Use Magic Device checks when using wands, and their Caster Level is increased by one. This caster level bonus increases by one at levels 6, 9, 12 and 15 and is capped by your Intelligence Bonus.

Feat.Name: Artificer Knowledge: Wondrous Items
Feat.Description: You have an instinctive understanding of magic items due to your extensive study of them. You gain a +2 bonus to Use Magic Device checks when using clothing, jewelry and trinkets and their Caster Level is increased by one. This caster level bonus increases by one at levels 10, 13, 16 and 19 and is capped by your Intelligence Bonus.

Feat.Name: Artificer Rune Arm Use
Feat.Description: You are able to equip and use magical relics called Rune Arms. This feat will set the rune arm to automatically begin charging whenever it can, slowing your movement while charging the relic. While you have a Rune Arm charging, tapping the Rune Arm Key (default: Alt) will fire the Rune Arm. You can freely perform most other actions while charging the Rune Arm.

Feat.Name: Athletic
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to your Balance and Swim skills.

Feat.Name: Attack
Feat.Description: This is the standard attack for all characters. It can be toggled on to attack repeatedly until your target is defeated, or activated once by right-clicking the mouse.

Stance.Name: Cloth Armor
Stance.Description: You are wearing cloth or no armor. If you are a construct you have the Composite Plating feat.

Stance.Name: Light Armor
Stance.Description: You are wearing light armor. If you are a construct you have the Mithral Body feat.

Stance.Name: Medium Armor
Stance.Description: You are wearing medium armor.

Stance.Name: Heavy Armor
Stance.Description: You are wearing heavy armor. If you are a construct you have the Adamantine Body feat.

Stance.Name: Centered
Stance.Description: Enabled if you are in a centered state of: In cloth armor (or composite plating only), You have light encumbrance or less weight, Weilding weapons that are centering such as a staff.

Stance.Name: Good
Stance.Description: You are Good

Stance.Name: Lawful
Stance.Description: You are Lawful

Stance.Name: Chaotic
Stance.Description: You are Chaotic

Stance.Name: True Neutral
Stance.Description: You are True Neutral

Stance.Name: Shield
Stance.Description: You are using a shield.

Stance.Name: Buckler
Stance.Description: You have a buckler in your off hand.

Stance.Name: Small Shield
Stance.Description: You have a small shield in your off hand.

Stance.Name: Large Shield
Stance.Description: You have a large shield in your off hand.

Stance.Name: Tower Shield
Stance.Description: You have a tower shield in your off hand.

DC.Name: Intimidate
DC.Description: Allows you to intimidate certain NPCs and to draw the attention of monsters while in battle. You will suffer a -4 penalty to your intimidate skill for every size category you are smaller than the creature your are trying to intimidate, or +4 for every size category your are larger. (15 second cooldown)

DC.Name: Diplomacy
DC.Description: Allows you to negotiate more effectively with certain NPCs and to encourage monsters to find targets other than yourself. Any accumulated threat you have with enemies that you successfully diplomacize is reduced. (15 second cooldown, Shares cooldown with Bluff)

DC.Name: Bluff
DC.Description: Allows you to bluff certain NPCs, draw monsters away from their group, or make an individual monster vulnerable to sneak attack for six seconds. You also gain a decrease in threat generation for a short period of time after successfully using this ability. (15 second cooldown, Shares cooldown with Diplomacy)

Feat.Name: Augment Summoning
Feat.Description: Your summoned creatures, charmed minions and hirelings have +4 to all ability scores, increased health and increased fortification.

Feat.Name: Aura of Courage
Feat.Description: A feeling of confidence and fearlessness surrounds you while near a paladin, granting a bonus to saves against fear.

Stance.Name: Aura of Courage
Stance.Description: A feeling of confidence and fearlessness surrounds you while near a paladin, granting a bonus to saves against fear.

Feat.Name: Aura of Good
Feat.Description: An aura of holiness surrounds you while near a paladin, granting a bonus to saves and Armor Class against evil creatures.

Stance.Name: Aura of Good
Stance.Description: An aura of holiness surrounds you while near a paladin, granting a bonus to saves and Armor Class against evil creatures.

Feat.Name: Bladeforged
Feat.Description: The devout of the Lord of Blades gain the rare benefit of meeting their god personally. Your strong faith increases the strength of your Aura of Good, giving +2 Armor Class and +1 to all saving throws. Blade Absorption: You take -10% Slashing damage. When you take slashing damage, you gain +1 stacking PPR for three seconds (up to +20 PRR). Stacks fade 1 at a time as metal bits fall off. Your positive healing is reduced -10% compared to other Warforged (-5% starting positive damage vulnerability). Your combat abilities on behalf of the Warforged race grants you the following magic as you gain spell levels: Repair Light Damage, Repair Moderate Damage, Mass Repair Light Damage, Repair Serious Damamge, Mass Repair Moderate Damage, Repair Critical Damage, Mass Repair Serious Damage.

Feat.Name: Bow Strength
Feat.Description: You apply your Strength bonus to bow damage.

Feat.Name: Breath of the Fire Dragon
Feat.Description: Fire:Fire:Fire Finisher - A cone of searing flame shoots forth, damaging targets in the area of the flames for 1 to 6 damage for each monk level. A successful Reflex save (DC 10 + Monk Level + Wisdom Modifier) reduces the damage by half. D&D Dice: Deals 1d6 fire damage per monk level.

DC.Name: Breath of the Fire Dragon
DC.Description: A cone of searing flame shoots forth, damaging targets in the area of the flames for 1 to 6 damage for each monk level.

Feat.Name: Brutal Throw
Feat.Description: You can use your Strength bonus instead of Dexterity bonus to determine bonus to attack with thrown weapons if it is higher.

Feat.Name: Bullheaded
Feat.Description: You are exceptionally headstrong and difficult to sway. You receive a +1 to Will saves and a +2 bonus on Intimidate checks.

Feat.Name: Call Wolf Companion
Feat.Description: Activate this ability to summon your Wolf Companion.

Feat.Name: Cleave
Feat.Description: Tactical Melee Cleave: Activate this ability to attack one or more enemies in an arc in front of you. This attack deals +1[W] damage.

Feat.Name: Combat Casting
Feat.Description: Provides a +4 bonus to the character's Concentration while casting spells in combat.

Feat.Name: Combat Expertise
Feat.Description: Defensive Combat Stance: While using Combat Expertise mode, you suffer -5 to your attack rolls but gain +10% feat bonus to Armor Class. Spells have three times their normal cooldown when this mode is active. Combat Expertise dispels and wards against all Rage effects.

Stance.Name: Combat Expertise
Stance.Description: While using Combat Expertise mode, you suffer -5 to your attack rolls but gain +10% feat bonus to Armor Class. Spells have three times their normal cooldown when this mode is active.

Feat.Name: Completionist
Feat.Description:
You win DDO! You've leveled to 20 in every class and for your effort you can take this feat to get a +2 bonus to all Skills and Ability scores. When more classes are added, this feat will deactivate and you will need to gain those past lives before this benefit reactivates.
Note: Although this feat is selectable at level 1, it can only be trained at level 1 by using a Feat exchange at Fred the Mindflayer.

Feat.Name: Racial Completionist
Feat.Description:
You're a cultural master! You have leveled to 20 in every race 3 times and for your efforts you are awarded this Feat in all future incarnations of this character. When more races are added, this feat will deactivate and you will need to gain those past lives before this benefit reactivates.
+2 to all Abilities and Skills

Feat.Name: Composite Plating
Feat.Description: You are not considered to be wearing armor. You have a 5% arcane spell failure chance.

Feat.Name: Construct Essence
Feat.Description: You are on the path to becoming a self-forged, augmenting yourself by replacing some of your weak flesh. You are still considered your original race (at this time), gaining 50% healing from Repair spells but suffering a -25% penalty to positive energy healing. In addition, you now take 50% damage from rust effects.

Feat.Name: Crippling Strike
Feat.Description: A rogue with this ability can sneak attack opponents with such precision that his or her blows weaken and hamper them. An opponent damaged by a sneak attack also takes 2 points of Strength damage.

Feat.Name: Curse of the Void
Feat.Description: Void:Dark:Void Finisher - You strike your opponent down with a terrible curse, confusing their mind and rendering them unable to recognize their friends. You can make an attack that charms your opponent for a short period of time. A successful Will save negates this effect. (DC 10 + Monk Level + Wisdom mod) Each time the target takes damage there is a chance that they will break free of this effect.

DC.Name: Curse of the Void
DC.Description: A cone of searing flame shoots forth, damaging targets in the area of the flames for 1 to 6 damage for each monk level.

Feat.Name: Dance Of Clouds
Feat.Description: Air:Light:Air Finisher - Activate this finisher to wrap all nearby allies in the stuff of clouds for a short period of time, granting them 20% concealment.

Feat.Name: Damage Reduction 3%
Feat.Description: A barbarian can resist physical damage, shrugging off 3% of non bane damage from each physical attack. This increases by 1% at 5th level and every three barbarian levels thereafter.

Feat.Name: Damage Reduction 1% Increase
Feat.Description: A barbarian can resist physical damage, shrugging off 3% of non bane damage from each physical attack. This increases by 1% at 5th level and every three barbarian levels thereafter.

Feat.Name: Defensive Fighting
Feat.Description: Defensive Combat Stance: While using Defensive Fighting mode, you gain a 5% bonus to AC and a -5% penalty to-hit. Casting a spell ends this mode.

Stance.Name: Defensive Fighting
Stance.Description: While using Defensive Fighting mode, you gain a 5% bonus to AC and a -5% penalty to-hit. Casting a spell ends this mode.

Feat.Name: Defensive Roll
Feat.Description: Grants the rogue a chance to cheat death when critically injured. When below 20% health, a rogue with Defensive Roll has a chance equal to their total Reflex Save Modifier of taking half damage from melee or ranged weapon attacks and negating any special effects associated with the attack as if the rogue were blocking. Defensive Roll is subject to the same armor and encumbrance restrictions as the Evasion class skill.

Feat.Name: Deflect Arrows
Feat.Description: Once every few seconds, you are able to block some projectiles that would otherwise hit you.

Feat.Name: Diamond Body
Feat.Description: You have firm control over your metabolism and are immune to ability score damage from natural poisons. You gain a +10 Racial bonus to saving throws against magical poisons and do not fail saving throws against them on a roll of a natural 1 (this renders you immune to magical poisons with a DC of less than 11+your Fortitude save).

Feat.Name: Diamond Soul
Feat.Description: You gain spell resistance equal to your monk level + 10, protecting you from non-damaging spells.

Feat.Name: Diehard
Feat.Description: You automatically stabilize when incapacitated.

Feat.Name: Disciple of Candles
Feat.Description: The sun burns with an eternal fire and you have taken your first steps on the path to understanding that power and intensity.

Feat.Name: Disciple of Pebbles
Feat.Description: The mountain is eternal and you have taken your first steps on the path to understanding the unyielding resilience of stone.

Feat.Name: Disciple of Puddles
Feat.Description: The sea is teeming with life in motion and you have taken your first steps on the path to understanding the way of the sea.

Feat.Name: Discipline
Feat.Description: You are difficult to distract with spell or blow. You receive a +1 bonus to Will saves and a +2 bonus on Concentration checks.

Feat.Name: Dismiss Charm
Feat.Description: Activate this short-ranged ability while targeting a charmed, commanded, controlled, or dominated enemy that is under your control to dispel the controlling effect.

Feat.Name: Dismiss Rage
Feat.Description: Activate this barbarian ability to prematurely end your rage.

Feat.Name: Divine Grace
Feat.Description: A paladin receives bonus to saves, equal to his or her Charisma bonus.

Feat.Name: Divine Health
Feat.Description: A paladin is immune to natural, magical and supernatural diseases.

Feat.Name: Dodge
Feat.Description: Grants you a 3% Dodge bonus. Bug: Also grants +1 AC.

Feat.Name: Drow Spell Resistance
Feat.Description: Drow are naturally resistant to spells and magical effects. You have a base Spell Resistance of 6 protecting you from many non-damaging spells and effects.

Feat.Name: Druidic Oath
Feat.Description: Druids are forbidden from wearing metal armors and using metal shields. Doing so suppresses your druidic abilities. Warforged druids are forbidden from taking armor feats other than Composite Body.

Feat.Name: Druidic Spontaneous Casting
Feat.Description: You gain an additional spell preparation slot per spell level to cast Summon Nature's Ally spell of that level.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Stability
Feat.Description: Dwarves naturally are able to keep their balance, receiving a +4 on their Balance skill.

Feat.Name: Dwarven Stonecutting
Feat.Description: Dwarves naturally are able to find secret doors more often, receiving a +2 bonus on their Search skill.

Feat.Name: Elven Keen Senses
Feat.Description: Elves have keen senses and gain a +2 bonus to Listen, Search and Spot checks.

Feat.Name: Empower Healing Spell
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, you gain 75 Spell Power while casting spells affected by Empower Healing, but they consume 10 additional spell points.

Stance.Name: Empower Healing
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, you gain 75 Spell Power while casting spells affected by Empower Healing, but they consume 10 additional spell points.

Feat.Name: Empower Spell
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, you gain 75 Spell Power while casting spells affected by Empower Spell, but they consume 15 additional spell points.

Stance.Name: Empower
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, you gain 75 Spell Power while casting spells affected by Empower Spell, but they consume 15 additional spell points.

Feat.Name: Empty Body
Feat.Description: You are able to focus your Ki and walk the edge of the Plane of Shadow, mimicing the effects of a Shadow Walk spell. While this effect is active, you move much faster than normal and your outline appears faint and you are harder to hit. Attacking another creature or otherwise interacting with objects shunts you back to the Material Plane.

Feat.Name: Enchantment Save Bonus
Feat.Description: Elves are naturally resistant to enchantments, receiving a +2 bonus on saves against enchantments.

Feat.Name: Energy Absorption: Acid
Feat.Description: You gain Acid Absorbance: 10%.

Feat.Name: Energy Absorption: Cold
Feat.Description: You gain Cold Absorbance: 10%.

Feat.Name: Energy Absorption: Electricity
Feat.Description: You gain Electricity Absorbance: 10%.

Feat.Name: Energy Absorption: Fire
Feat.Description: You gain Fire Absorbance: 10%.

Feat.Name: Energy Absorption: Sonic
Feat.Description: You gain Sonic Absorbance: 10%.

Feat.Name: Enlarge Spell
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, spells have twice the range, but they consume 10 additional spell points.

Stance.Name: Enlarge
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, spells have twice the range, but they consume 10 additional spell points.

Feat.Name: Eschew Materials
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, normal material components are not required, but spells consume 2 additional spell points.

Stance.Name: Eschew Materials
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, normal material components are not required, but spells consume 2 additional spell points.

Feat.Name: Evasion
Feat.Description: When you make a successful Reflex save to avoid damage, you suffer no damage instead of half damage.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Bastard Sword
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a bastard sword. Bastard swords deal grazing hits as if they were a two handed weapon if they are the only weapon wielded by a proficient user. (Sword and shield or single weapon attack styles.)

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Dwarven Axe
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a dwarven axe. Dwarven axes deal grazing hits as if they were a two handed weapon if they are the only weapon wielded by a proficient user. (Axe and shield or single weapon attack styles.)

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Great Crossbow
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a great crossbow. Great crossbows may knock opponents to the ground on a confirmed attack roll of a natural 20.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Handwraps
Feat.Description: This feat negates the -4 penalty to attack rolls from using Handwraps untrained.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Kama
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a kama.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Khopesh
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a khopesh.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Repeating Heavy Crossbow
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty to attack rolls when using a repeating heavy crossbow. Repeating crossbows fire multiple times before reloading in the hands of the proficient wielder.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Repeating Light Crossbow
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty to attack rolls when using a repeating light crossbow. Repeating crossbows fire multiple times before reloading in the hands of the proficient wielder.

Feat.Name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency: Shuriken
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty to attack rolls when using a shuriken.

Feat.Name: Extend Spell
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, spells with durations last twice as long, but they consume 10 additional spell points.

Stance.Name: Extend
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, spells with durations last twice as long, but they consume 10 additional spell points.

Feat.Name: Extra Turning
Feat.Description: Allows you to turn undead four more times per rest period.

Feat.Name: Fascinate
Feat.Description: Activate this bard ability to make your foes stop what they're doing and listen to your soothing notes. Requires 3 trained ranks (not total mod) of the Perform skill to use. Has a save DC of your perform skill plus the roll of a twenty-sided die.

DC.Name: Fascinate
DC.Description: Activate this bard ability to make your foes stop what they're doing and listen to your soothing notes.

Feat.Name: Fast Movement (Monk)
Feat.Description: While centered you run faster for every three monk levels you possess.

Feat.Name: Fast Movement (Barbarian)
Feat.Description: The Fast Movement class feat allows a Barbarian to move 10% faster.

Feat.Name: Falling Star Strike
Feat.Description: Air:Dark:Air Finisher - You have studied esoteric nerve strikes. You can make an attack that has a chance of blinding your opponent. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect. (DC 10 + Monk Level + Wisdom mod) The target receives periodic saves to attempt to break free of this effect.

DC.Name: Falling Star Strike
DC.Description: You have studied esoteric nerve strikes. You can make an attack that has a chance of blinding your opponent.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Aberration
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking aberrations.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Animal
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking animals.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Chaotic Outsider
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking chaotic outsiders.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Construct
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking constructs.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Dragon
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking dragons.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Dwarf
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking dwarves.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Elemental
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking elementals.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Elf
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking elves.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Evil Outsider
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking evil outsiders.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Giant
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking giants.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Gnoll
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking gnolls.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Goblinoid
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking goblinoids.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Halfling
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking halflings.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Human
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking humans.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Lawful Outsider
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking lawful outsiders.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Magical Beast
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking magical beasts.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Monstrous Humanoid
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking monstrous humanoids.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Ooze
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking oozes.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Orc
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking orcs.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Plant
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking plants.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Reptilian
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking reptilians.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Undead
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking undead.

Feat.Name: Favored enemy: Vermin
Feat.Description: You receive a damage bonus when attacking vermin.

Feat.Name: Fear Immunity
Feat.Description: A paladin is immune to fear effects.

Feat.Name: Finishing Moves
Feat.Description: Through careful use of their abilities, monks can unlock special finishing moves to perform amazing effects. This button changes into various finishing moves as they become available.

Feat.Name: Fires of Purity I
Feat.Description: You strike an opponent, backed with the power of flame. Your attack will deal 1 to 6 additional fire damage (D&D Dice: 1d6).

Feat.Name: Flowing Water Strike I
Feat.Description: You strike an opponent, backed with the power of the sea. Your attack will deal 1 to 6 additional cold damage (D&D Dice: 1d6).

Feat.Name: Flurry of Blows
Feat.Description: While centered you get an increase to your attack bonus and a 2% dodge bonus at monk levels 1, 2 and 4 for a total of 6%. The attack bonus increase starts at +1 (at level 1) and increases by +1 for every four additional monk levels.

Feat.Name: Force of Personality
Feat.Description: Adds your Charisma modifier to your Will saves instead of your Wisdom modifier.

Feat.Name: Freezing The Lifeblood
Feat.Description: Water:Dark:Water Finisher - Your attacks can paralyze humanoid opponents. You strike at pressure points, paralyzing them and rendering them helpless for a short period of time. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect. (DC 10 + Monk Level + Wisdom mod) The target receives periodic saves to attempt to break free of this effect.

DC.Name: Freezing The Lifeblood
DC.Description: Your attacks can paralyze humanoid opponents. You strike at pressure points, paralyzing them and rendering them helpless for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Grandmaster of Forms
Feat.Description: You continue on the path to enlightenment, further improving your elemental stances and learning new elemental strikes. These stance improvements replace those granted by Master of Forms. Grandmaster of Flame: Sun Stance now grants +4 Strength and the critical multiplier of all weapons you use is increased by 1 on rolls of a natural 19 or 20, at a cost of -2 Wisdom. While in Sun Stance you gain 'Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.' and 'Critical Effect: Gain 5 Ki.' Grandmaster of Rain: Ocean Stance now grants +4 Wisdom, +12 Dodge, a +8 bonus to dodge cap, +5 to all Saving Throws and your passive Ki generation when centered is increased by 1, at a cost of -2 Strength. Grandmaster of Rock: Mountain Stance now grants +4 Constitution, a 20% boost to AC, 15 physical resistance, a +70% Insight bonus to melee threat generation, at the cost of -2 Dexterity and -10% movement speed. While in Mountain Stance, you gain 'Get Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.' Grandmaster of Wind: Wind Stance now grants +4 Dexterity, a 15% Enhancement bonus to melee and thrown attack speed and grants a 12% chance to doublestrike with melee weapons, at the cost of -2 Constitution.

Feat.Name: Goodberry
Feat.Description: Transmutes natural matter around you into Goodberries. Goodberries are infused with primal magic and provide a full meal's nourishment. If eaten in a tavern, they act as tavern food and drink, refilling your health and spell points. When cast, Goodberries appear in your inventory. The higher the caster level, the more nourishing the Goodberries are.

Feat.Name: Gnomish Proficiencies
Feat.Description: You have some special bonuses due to your gnomish heritage. +2 Haggle, +2 Use Magic Device, Proficient with Light Hammers, Throwing Hammers and Warhammers.

Feat.Name: Grasp Of The Earth Dragon
Feat.Description: Earth:Light:Earth Finisher - Activate this finisher to fill all nearby allies with the strength of the earth, granting them immunity to daze, stun and sleep for a short period of time.

Feat.Name: Great Cleave
Feat.Description: Activate this ability to attack one or more enemies in a wide arc in front of you. This attack deals +2[W] damage.

Feat.Name: Great Fortitude
Feat.Description: Grants you a +2 bonus on your Fortitude saves.

Feat.Name: Greater Rage
Feat.Description: A barbarian's rage grows stronger after reaching 11th level. You have an additional +2 Strength and Constitution and +1 Will save while raged.

Feat.Name: Greater Single Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: Your Single-Weapon Fighting bonus is increased to a +30% Combat Style bonus to attack speed and +2 additional Melee Power (for a total of 6) and 50% more of your appropriate ability score to your damage (similar to Two-Handed Fighting).

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Abjuration
Feat.Description: Your spells from the Abjuration school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Conjuration
Feat.Description: Your spells from the Conjuration school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Enchantment
Feat.Description: Your spells of the Enchantment school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Evocation
Feat.Description: Your spells of the Evocation school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Illusion
Feat.Description: Your spells of the Illusion school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Necromancy
Feat.Description: Your spells of the Necromancy school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Focus: Transmutation
Feat.Description: Your spells of the Transmutation school of magic are harder to resist, receiving an additional +1 bonus on save DCs.

Feat.Name: Greater Spell Penetration
Feat.Description: Adds +2 to your caster level check for defeating spell resistance (in addition to the +2 from the Spell Penetration feat).

Feat.Name: Greater Two Handed Fighting
Feat.Description: Increases the damage of glancing blow attacks when wielding a two-handed weapon by an additional 10% for a total of 50%. Also increases the chance for weapon effects to trigger on glancing blows by an additional 3% (9%) and an additional +2 to Melee Power (total of +6).

Feat.Name: Greater Two Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: Increases the chance to produce off hand attacks when fighting with two weapons (or as an unarmed monk) by an additional 20% to 80%.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Focus: Bludgeoning Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +1 bonus to attack rolls when using a bludgeoning weapon, including attacks from a druid in animal form and an additional +2 stacking Melee Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Focus feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Focus: Piercing Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +1 bonus to attack rolls when using a piercing weapon and an additional +2 stacking Melee Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Focus feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Focus: Ranged Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +1 bonus to attack rolls when using a ranged weapon and an additional +2 stacking Ranged Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Focus feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Focus: Slashing Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +1 bonus to attack rolls when using a slashing weapon and an additional +2 stacking Melee Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Focus feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Focus: Thrown Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +1 bonus to attack rolls when using a thrown weapon and an additional +2 stacking Ranged Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Focus feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Specialization: Bludgeoning Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to damage rolls when using a bludgeoning weapon, including attacks from a druid in animal form and +2 stacking Melee Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Specialization feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Specialization: Piercing Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to damage rolls when using a piercing weapon and +2 stacking Melee Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Specialization feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Specialization: Ranged Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to damage rolls when using a ranged weapon and +2 stacking Ranged Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Specialization feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Specialization: Slashing Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to damage rolls when using a slashing weapon and +2 stacking Melee Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Specialization feat.

Feat.Name: Greater Weapon Specialization: Thrown Weapons
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to damage rolls when using a thrown weapon and +2 stacking Ranged Power. This bonus stacks with the Weapon Specialization feat.

Feat.Name: Half-Elven Keen Senses
Feat.Description: Half-elves have gained some of the keen senses of the elves and gain a +1 racial bonus to Listen, Search and Spot checks.

Feat.Name: Half-Elven Social Graces
Feat.Description: Half-elves get along naturally with all people and gain a +2 racial bonus to Diplomacy. They also gain additional Bluff, Diplomacy and Intimidate uses on a separate cooldown timer.

Feat.Name: Half-Elven Social Graces: Bluff
Feat.Description: Allows you to attempt to make monsters vulnerable to a sneak attack.

Feat.Name: Half-Elven Social Graces: Diplomacy
Feat.Description: Allows you to attempt to encourage monsters to find targets other than yourself.

Feat.Name: Half-Elven Social Graces: Intimidate
Feat.Description: Allows you to attempt to draw the attention of monsters. You get a bonus when intimidating creatures smaller than you and a penalty when intimidating creatures that are larger than you.

Feat.Name: Half-Elven Mixed Heritage
Feat.Description: Half-elves are treated as both an elf and a human by magical items and effects if one would be beneficial. Negative effects treat half-elves as if they were elves.

Feat.Name: Halfling Agility
Feat.Description: Halflings are agile and gain a +2 bonus to Jump and Move Silently checks.

Feat.Name: Halfling Bravery
Feat.Description: Halflings are naturally resistant to fear and gain a +2 morale bonus to saves against fear.

Feat.Name: Halfling Keen Ears
Feat.Description: Halflings have keen ears and gain a +2 bonus to Listen checks.

Feat.Name: Halfling Luck
Feat.Description: Halflings are surprisingly lucky and gain a +1 bonus to all saves.

Feat.Name: Halfling Thrown Weapon Focus
Feat.Description: Halflings develop their throwing skill starting at a very young age. As a result, halflings get a +1 bonus to attack rolls when using any thrown weapon.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Artificer
Feat.Description: You have watched the artificers of House Cannith work their trade. You gain proficiency with all crossbows and Artificer Knowledge: Scrolls (You gain a +2 bonus to Use Magic Device checks when using scrolls and their Caster Level is increased by one - this Caster Level increase is capped by your Intelligence modifier.) You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Artificer. For item use purposes you count as a level one Artificer in addition to any other classes you possess (though this does not grant the ability to use Rune Arms). This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Artificer levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Barbarian
Feat.Description: You have become toughened by time spent outdoors and amongst barbarian tribes. You gain Damage Reduction 1/- as if you were a barbarian. This feat does not stack with Barbarian Damage Reduction. For item use purposes, you count as a level one Barbarian in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual barbarian levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Bard
Feat.Description: You have the gift of song and have learned a few tips from famous bards. You can produce a Bardic Fascinate effect three times per rest that mesmerizes nearby enemies, with a Will DC based on a Perform check (or 1d20 + Charisma Modifier if untrained) to negate. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Bard and for item use purposes you count as a level one Bard in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Bard levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Cleric
Feat.Description: You have learned much by watching clerics perform their arts. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Cleric and for item use purposes you count as a level one Cleric in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Cleric levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Druid
Feat.Description: You have watched some of the secret rituals of the druids. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Druid and for item use purposes you count as a level one Druid in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Druid levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Favored Soul
Feat.Description: You have fought alongside the chosen of the gods and a little bit of divine favor appears to have rubbed off on you. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Favored Soul and for item use purposes you count as a level one Favored Soul in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Favored Soul levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Fighter
Feat.Description: You have trained with the best and your martial skills have improved. You gain proficiency with all martial melee weapons and for item use purposes you count as a level one Fighter in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Fighter levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Monk
Feat.Description: You have meditated alongside monks in the most remote of places. You gain proficiency with the quarterstaff, kama and shuriken and can add up to 2 points of your Wisdom bonus to your Armor Class as long as you are Defensively Centered (unarmored and unencumbered). This Armor Class bonus does not stack with the similar monk class ability. For item use purposes you count as a level one Monk in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Monk levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Paladin
Feat.Description: You have spent enough time among holy warriors that you know their chants by heart. You can add up to 2 points of your Charisma bonus to all saves. This bonus does not stack with the Divine Grace ability. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Paladin and for item use purposes you count as a level one Paladin in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Paladin levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Ranger
Feat.Description: You have hunted with some of the greatest rangers of Khorvaire. You gain proficiency with all martial ranged weapons and can add up to 2 points of your Strength bonus to bow damage. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Ranger. For item use purposes you count as a level one Ranger in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Ranger levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Rogue
Feat.Description: You have learned a few tricks from less reputable sources. You deal +1d6 Sneak Attack damage, but this does not stack with the Rogue Sneak Attack ability. For item use purposes you count as a level one Rogue in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Rogue levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Sorcerer
Feat.Description: Your travels and adventures seem to have awakened a bit of power within your blood. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Sorcerer and for item use purposes you count as a level one Sorcerer in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Sorcerer levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Warlock
Feat.Description: Able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Warlock. Toggle: You deal 1D4 extra Fire damage with attacks and spells. This trigger at most once every two seconds. This toggle is exclusive with Warlock Pact toggles.

Feat.Name: Half-Elf Dilettante: Wizard
Feat.Description: You have studied ancient tomes alongside powerful wizards. You are able to use wands and scrolls as if you were a level one Wizard and for item use purposes you count as a level one Wizard in addition to any other classes you possess. This feat is not recommended for characters with actual Wizard levels.

Feat.Name: Half-Orc Orc Blood
Feat.Description: Half-Orcs are treated as an orc by magical items and effects.

Feat.Name: Hamstring
Feat.Description: Tactical Melee Attack: Using this attack, you may reduce the target's movement rate by half for 12 seconds. Some creatures may be immune to the hamstring effect.

Feat.Name: Healing Ki
Feat.Description: Light:Light:Light Finisher - Activate this finisher to heal all nearby allies for 1 to 4 points of positive energy, plus an additional 1 to 4 every two monk levels. D&D Dice: Heals allies with 1d4 positive energy for every two monk levels.

Feat.Name: Heavy Armor Champion
Feat.Description: While wearing heavy armor: +12 Physical Resistance, +12 Magical Resistance

Feat.Name: Heavy Armor Master
Feat.Description: While wearing heavy armor: +9 Physical Resistance, +9 Magical Resistance

Feat.Name: Heavy Armor Combatant
Feat.Description: While wearing heavy armor: +6 Physical Resistance, +6 Magical Resistance

Feat.Name: Heavy Armor Training
Feat.Description: While wearing heavy armor: +3 Physical Resistance, +3 Magical Resistance

Feat.Name: Heavy Armor Proficiency
Feat.Description: You are proficient with heavy armor and do not suffer armor penalties to your attack rolls when wearing heavy armor. You also gain 2 times your BAB in physical resistance when wearing heavy armor.

Feat.Name: Heighten Spell
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, your spells are raised to the highest spell level your character can cast, making them more difficult to resist, but increasing their spell point cost.

Stance.Name: Heighten
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, your spells are raised to the highest spell level your character can cast, making them more difficult to resist, but increasing their spell point cost.

Feat.Name: Heroic Durability
Feat.Description: Increases your maximum hit points by 30.

Feat.Name: Hide in Plain Sight
Feat.Description: You are a master when it comes to hiding in places others think impossible. You gain +1 Hide and +1 Move Silently for every three seconds you stand still, up to +5. While you are sneaking and standing still (for 3 seconds), enemies don't gain Spot bonuses until they get much closer to you, and the bonuses are smaller.

Feat.Name: Immunity to Sleep
Feat.Description: Elves and Half-Elves are naturally immune to magical sleep effects.

Feat.Name: Improved Construct Essence
Feat.Description: You have augmented yourself heavily enough to be more machine than not. You are now considered a Living Construct instead of your original race, gaining the following traits: 100% base healing from Repair spells and 100% damage from Rust. Immunity to Sleep, Hold Person, Energy Drain, Nasueated, Exhausted and Paralyzed effects except those which physically hold you in place. Immunity to ability score damage from natural poisons and natural diseases (but are vulnerable to those that specifically affect wood or metal). +10 Racial bonus to saving throws against magical poisons and do not failed saving throws against them on a roll of a natural 1 (this renders you immune to magical poisons with a DC of less than 11+your Fortitude save). You may remain underwater indefinitely without the need to breathe. When resting at a Rest Shrine, the health you regain is now based on your Repair skill instead of your Heal skill. If you transform into a different type of creature, you will lose these benefits until you return to your normal form.

Feat.Name: Improved Critical: Bludgeoning Weapons
Feat.Description: Doubles the base critical hit threat range of any bludgeoning weapon you use, including attacks from a druid in animal form. This feat does not stack with item effects that double threat range like keen and impact.

Feat.Name: Improved Critical: Piercing Weapons
Feat.Description: Doubles the base critical hit threat range of any piercing weapon you use. This feat does not stack with item effects that double threat range like keen and impact.

Feat.Name: Improved Critical: Ranged Weapons
Feat.Description: Doubles the base critical hit threat range of any ranged weapon you use. This feat does not stack with item effects that double threat range like keen and impact.

Feat.Name: Improved Critical: Slashing Weapons
Feat.Description: Doubles the base critical hit threat range of any slashing weapon you use. This feat does not stack with item effects that double threat range like keen and impact.

Feat.Name: Improved Critical: Thrown Weapons
Feat.Description: Doubles the base critical hit threat range of any thrown weapon you use. This feat does not stack with item effects that double threat range like keen and impact.

Feat.Name: Improved Damage Reduction
Feat.Description: You gain damage reduction 1/adamantine, or improve your existing damage reduction by 1/adamantine.

Feat.Name: Improved Evasion
Feat.Description: When you fail a Reflex save to avoid damage, you suffer only half damage.

Feat.Name: Improved Feint
Feat.Description: An attack which also Bluffs the enemy, enabling sneak attacks.

Feat.Name: Improved Fortification
Feat.Description: Improves your warforged fortification, granting you immunity to sneak attacks and extra damage from critical hits. However, you lose the ability to be healed by spells from the healing subschool, such as cure light wounds.

Feat.Name: Improved Heroic Durability
Feat.Description: +5 Maximum Hit Points.

Feat.Name: Improved Mental Toughness
Feat.Description: This feat increases the character maximum spell points by 10 at level 1 and 5 spell points for each additional level. Also increases your spell critical chance by 1%. Stacks with Mental Toughness.

Feat.Name: Improved Precise Shot
Feat.Description: Your ranged attacks will now pass through friends and foes to damage all foes in your path, until they strike your intended target.

Stance.Name: Improved Precise Shot
Stance.Description: Your ranged attacks will now pass through friends and foes to damage all foes in your path, until they strike your intended target.

Feat.Name: Improved Shield Bash
Feat.Description: You keep your shield bonus while bashing with a shield and gain a 20% chance to make a secondary shield bash while attacking.

Feat.Name: Improved Shield Mastery
Feat.Description: You are exceptionally skilled with the use of a shield and your physical resistance is increased by an additional 5 when using a buckler or small shield, 10 when using a large shield, or 15 when using a tower shield. Your Doublestrike chance while using a shield is increased by 5% to a total of 8%. Add +3 Melee Power(for a total of +6)

Feat.Name: Improved Single Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: Your Single-Weapon Fighting bonus is increased to a +20% Combat Style bonus to attack speed and an additional 2 Melee Power (for a total of 4). You now apply 25% more of your appropriate ability score to your damage instead of just your ability score (for instance, you add 1.25 times your Strength as damage).

Feat.Name: Improved Sunder
Feat.Description: This melee special attack results in a -5 AC penalty and -10% fortification to the target for 24 seconds, if the target fails a Fortitude save (DC 14 + Str mod + Sunder modifiers). Whether successful or unsuccessful, this attack will also reduce an enemy's Fortitude save by 3, stacking up to 5 times. Some creatures may be immune to the sunder effect

DC.Name: Improved Sunder
DC.Description: This melee special attack results in a -5 AC penalty and -10% fortification to the target for 24 seconds, if the target fails a Fortitude save.

Feat.Name: Improved Trip
Feat.Description: Tactical Melee Attack: Using this attack, you may trip the target, rendering it prone for a longer time. Some creatures may be immune to this effect. A successful Balance check negates this effect. (DC 14 + Str mod + Trip modifiers)

DC.Name: Improved Trip
DC.Description: Tactical Melee Attack: Using this attack, you may trip the target, rendering it prone for a longer time. Some creatures may be immune to this effect. A successful Balance check negates this effect.

Feat.Name: Improved Turning
Feat.Description: This feat gives clerics and paladins a better chance at turning the undead. You Turn Undead as if you were 1 level higher.

Feat.Name: Improved Two Handed Fighting
Feat.Description: Increases the damage of glancing blow attacks when wielding a two-handed weapon by an additional 10%. Also increases the chance for weapon effects to trigger on glancing blows by an additional 3% and an additional +2 Combat Style bonus to Melee Power (total of +4).

Feat.Name: Improved Two Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: Increases the chance to produce off hand attacks when fighting with two weapons (or as an unarmed monk) by an additional 20% to 60%.

Feat.Name: Improved Uncanny Dodge
Feat.Description: Activate this ability to gain a temporary 25% Dodge bonus and +6 reflex save bonus. This feat also grants you a 1% passive bonus to Dodge at levels 4, 6, 8, 12, 16 and 20.

Feat.Name: Improved Wild Empathy
Feat.Description: Activate this ranger ability to befriend an animal or beast.

Feat.Name: Infernal Ancestry
Feat.Description: You gain Fire Resistance equal to your Character Level. You gain +2 to the Balance skill, as well as a +2 bonus to Saves vs Spells. You have a +2 bonus to hit and damage against Lawful and Good Outsiders. You are Immune to Fear.

Feat.Name: Fiendish Arpeggio
Feat.Description:
Enchant your fiddle to cast this spell, dealing 2d4 Fire damage, plus 1 fire damage per 2 caster levels (max 2d4+10), to a target. The damage repeats itself every 2 seconds for 12 seconds.
Passive: +18 Spell Points

Feat.Name: Inscribe Artificer Scroll
Feat.Description: You are able to inscribe artificer spells from scrolls into your spellbook. This action will destroy the scroll.

Feat.Name: Inscribe Wizard Scroll
Feat.Description: You are able to inscribe wizard spells from scrolls into your spellbook. This action will destroy the scroll.

Feat.Name: Indomitable Will
Feat.Description: While in a rage, the barbarian receives a +4 bonus on Will saves to resist enchantment spells. This bonus stacks with all modifiers.

Feat.Name: Insightful Reflexes
Feat.Description: Adds your Intelligence modifier to Reflex saves instead of your Dexterity modifier.

Feat.Name: Iron Will
Feat.Description: Grants you a +2 bonus on your Will saves.

Feat.Name: Karmic Strike
Feat.Description: Fire-Dark-Fire Finisher - You have learned to strike at the moment your opponent is the most vulnerable - the same moment your opponent strikes you. This attack is guaranteed to produce critical threat if it hits, but costs 20 hit points to perform.

Feat.Name: Ki Strike: Adamantine
Feat.Description: All of your unarmed melee attacks are empowered with Ki and are considered adamantine for damage reduction purposes.

Feat.Name: Ki Strike: Lawful
Feat.Description: All of your unarmed melee attacks are empowered with Ki and are considered lawful for damage reduction purposes.

Feat.Name: Ki Strike: Magic
Feat.Description: All of your unarmed melee attacks are empowered with Ki and are considered magical for damage reduction purposes.

Feat.Name: Lay on Hands
Feat.Description: Activate this paladin ability to apply a burst of holiness to your target, either healing an amount based on your paladin level times your Charisma bonus or dealing that much damage to an undead target.

Feat.Name: Leap Of Faith
Feat.Description: You are able to leap through the air to bring the fight to your enemies or traverse chasms that make normal adventurers balk. Using this ability costs 10 spell points. Uses of this ability recharge at a rate of one every 15 seconds. (5 uses, 3 second cooldown.)

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Finding
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Tharashk bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Search skill. Activate this ability to harness the bloodline of House Tharashk to Locate Objects three times per rest. Locate Objects allows you to target a breakable object and find something temporary (but potentially useful) within it when it is broken.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Healing
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Jorasco bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Heal skill. Activate this ability to cast Cure Light Wounds three times per rest.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Making
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Cannith bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Repair skill and +3 Feat bonus to all crafting skills. Activate this ability to cast Repair Light Damage three times per rest.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Passage
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Orien bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Balance skill. Activate this ability to cast Expeditious Retreat to increase your running speed by 25% for one minute per character level.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Sentinel
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Deneith bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Intimidate skill. Activate this ability to cast Shield of Faith three times per rest. Shield of Faith gives you a deflection bonus to your AC. The amount increases with your character level.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Shadow
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Phiarlan bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Hide skill. Activate this ability to cast Invisibility three times per rest.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Scribing
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Sivis bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Use Magic Device Skill. Activate this ability to scribe runes on your glove or gauntlet, casting the Shield spell.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Storm
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Lyrandar bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Balance skill. Activate this ability to cast Gust of Wind three times per rest. Gust of Wind creates a severe blast of wind that slows enemy movement and disperses clouds.

Feat.Name: Least Dragonmark of Warding
Feat.Description: The bloodline of House Kundarak bestows on you a +2 bonus to your Search skill. Activate this ability to cast Neutralize Poison three times per rest.

Feat.Name: Mountain Stance
Feat.Description: The unyielding mountain stance focuses on endurance and defense. Lesser Mountain Stance grants +2 Constitution, a 5% boost to AC, 3 physical resistance and a +25% Insight bonus to melee threat generation, at the cost of -2 Dexterity and -10% movement speed. While in Lesser Mountain Stance, you gain 'Get Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.

Stance.Name: Mountain Stance
Stance.Description: Mountain Stance grants: +2/2/3/4 Constitution 5/10/15/20% boost to AC 3/8/12/15 physical resistance +25/40/55/70% Insight bonus to melee threat generation at the cost of -2 Dexterity and -10% movement speed.

Feat.Name: Ocean Stance
Feat.Description: The eternal ocean focuses on redirection and the supernatural. Lesser Ocean Stance grants +2 Wisdom, +1% dodge and +2 to all Saving Throws at a cost of -2 Strength.

Stance.Name: Ocean Stance
Stance.Description: Ocean Stance grants: +2/2/3/4 Wisdom +1/5/9/12% dodge, 0/4/6/8% Dodge Cap +2/3/4/5 to all Saving Throws at a cost of -2 Strength.

Feat.Name: Sun Stance
Feat.Description: The consuming flame focuses on an aggressive offense. Lesser Sun Stance grants +2 Strength at a cost of -2 Wisdom. While in Lesser Sun Stance you gain 'Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.' and 'Critical Effect: Gain 2 Ki.'

Stance.Name: Sun Stance
Stance.Description: Sun Stance grants: +2/2/3/4 Strength a +1 critical multiplier on a roll of 19/20 at tier 3 at a cost of -2 Wisdom.

Feat.Name: Wind Stance
Feat.Description: The relentless storm focuses on movement and speed. Lesser Wind Stance grants +2 Dexterity, a 7.5% Enhancement bonus to melee and thrown attack speed and grants a 2.5% chance to doublestrike with melee weapons, at the cost of -2 Constitution.

Stance.Name: Wind Stance
Stance.Description: Wind Stance grants: +2/2/3/4 Dexterity +7.5/10/12.5/15% Enhancement bonus to melee and thrown attack speed +2.5/6/9/12% chance to doublestrike with melee weapons at the cost of -2 Constitution.

Feat.Name: Light Armor Proficiency
Feat.Description: You are proficient with light armor and do not suffer armor penalties to your attack rolls when wearing light armor. You also gain you BAB in physical resistance when wearing light armor.

Feat.Name: Light Fortification
Feat.Description: Warforged have a 25% immunity to critical hits and sneak attacks.

Feat.Name: Lightning Reflexes
Feat.Description: Grants you a +2 bonus on your Reflex saves.

Feat.Name: Luck Of Heroes
Feat.Description: Grants a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

Feat.Name: Magical Training
Feat.Description: This feat increases the maximum spell points by 80, increases the spell critical chance by 5% and grants Echoes of Power if the spell points pool drops below 12.

Feat.Name: Manyshot
Feat.Description: For the next 20 seconds, add your BAB * 4 to your Doubleshot and Ranged power. This ability puts Ten Thousand Stars on a 30 second cooldown. Cooldown: 2 minutes.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Battle Axe
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a battle axe.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Falchion
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a falchion.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Great Axe
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a great axe.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Great Club
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a great club.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Great Sword
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a Great Sword.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Hand Axe
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a hand axe.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Heavy Pick
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a heavy pick.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Kukri
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a kukri.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Light Hammer
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a light hammer.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Light Pick
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a light pick.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Longbow
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a longbow.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Longsword
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a longsword.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Maul
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a maul.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Rapier
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a rapier.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Scimitar
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a scimitar.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Shortsword
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a shortsword.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Shortbow
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a shortbow.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Throwing Axe
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a throwing axe.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Throwing Hammer
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a throwing hammer.

Feat.Name: Martial Weapon Proficiency: Warhammer
Feat.Description: You do not suffer a -4 penalty on attack rolls when using a warhammer.

Feat.Name: Mass Suggestion
Feat.Description: Activate this bard ability to charm multiple fascinated foes for a short time. Requires 21 trained ranks (not total mod) of the Perform skill to use.

Feat.Name: Master of Forms
Feat.Description: You continue on the path to enlightenment, further improving your elemental stances and learning new elemental strikes. These stance improvements replace those granted by Adept of Forms. Master of Flame: Sun Stance now grants +3 Strength and the critical multiplier of all weapons you use is increased by 1 on rolls of a natural 19 or 20, at a cost of -2 Wisdom. While in Greater Sun Stance you gain 'Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki.' and 'Critical Effect: Gain 4 Ki. Master of Rain: Ocean Stance now grants +3 Wisdom, +9% dodge, +6 Maximum Dodge, +4 to all Saving Throws and your passive Ki generation when centered is increased by 1, at a cost of -2 Strength. Master of Rock: Mountain Stance now grants +3 Constitution, a 15% boost to AC, 12 physical resistance, a +55% Insight bonus to melee threat generation, at the cost of -2 Dexterity and -10% movement speed. While in Greater Mountain Stance, you gain 'Get Hit Effect: Gain 1 Ki. Master of Wind: Wind Stance now grants +3 Dexterity, a 12.5% Enhancement bonus to melee and thrown attack speed and grants a 9% chance to doublestrike with melee weapons, at the cost of -2 Constitution.

Feat.Name: Maximize Spell
Feat.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, you gain 150 Spell Power while casting spells affected by Maximize Spell, but they consume 25 additional spell points.

Stance.Name: Maximize
Stance.Description: While this metamagic feat is active, you gain 150 Spell Power while casting spells affected by Maximize Spell, but they consume 25 additional spell points.

Feat.Name: Meditation
Feat.Description: Your enlightenment allows you to regenerate Ki at a faster rate.

Feat.Name: Medium Armor Proficiency
Feat.Description: You are proficient with medium armor and do not suffer armor penalties to your attack rolls when wearing medium armor. You also gain 1.5 * BAB in physical resistance when wearing medium armor.

Feat.Name: Mental Toughness
Feat.Description: This feat Increases the character maximum spell points by 10 at level 1 and 5 spell points for each additional level. Also increases your spell critical chance by 1%.

Feat.Name: Mighty Rage
Feat.Description: Upon reaching level 20, a barbarian's rage grows stronger. When raging, your base bonus to Strength and Constitution are increased to +8 and your morale bonus to Will saves is increased to +4.

Feat.Name: Mithral Body
Feat.Description: Docents you equip provide armor equivalent to Chainmail. This is treated as metallic light armor. You have a 15% arcane spell failure chance, -1 armor check penalty to certain skills and a +5 maximum dexterity bonus.

Feat.Name: Mithral Fluidity
Feat.Description: The maximum Dex bonus you have is increased by 1 and the armor check penalties are decreased by 1.

Feat.Name: Mobile Spellcasting
Feat.Description: You now move at normal speed when casting a spell.

Feat.Name: Mobility
Feat.Description: Increases the maximum dexterity bonus permitted by armor and tower shields by 2 and adds a +4 bonus to Armor Class while tumbling. You will also gain a 2% Dodge bonus.

Feat.Name: Moment of Clarity
Feat.Description: Void:Light:Void Finisher - Activate this finisher to clear away all distractions from your allies, granting a +5 Insight bonus to hit and a +5 Insight bonus to skill checks for a very short period of time. This ability functions only in private instances.

Feat.Name: Natural Fighting
Feat.Description: Natural Fighting grants you +4 Melee Power, Physical Resistance and Doublestrike chance while in a druid animal form. In bear form, your glancing blow damage is increased by 10% of base weapon damage. This feat can be taken up to three times, and gives no benefit to druids in elemental forms.

Feat.Name: Negotiator
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to the character's Diplomacy and Haggle skills.

Feat.Name: Nimble Fingers
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to the character's Disable Device and Open Lock skills.

Feat.Name: Opportunist
Feat.Description: A rogue with this ability gains a 3% chance to double strike with melee weapons and bypasses 10% fortification.

Feat.Name: Orc and Goblin Bonus
Feat.Description: Dwarves get a +1 bonus to attack against orcs and goblins.

Feat.Name: Oversized Two Weapon Fighting
Feat.Description: When wielding a one handed weapon in your off-hand, you take penalties for fighting with two weapons as if you were wielding a light weapon in your off-hand.

Effect.DisplayName: Fake effect to cause updated, never displayed

Feat.Name: Pain Touch
Feat.Description: Earth:Dark:Earth Finisher - Your attacks can twist the Ki in a living creature. Your strike disrupts the harmony within your opponent, rending them nauseated. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect. (DC 10 + Monk Level + Wisdom mod) The target receives periodic saves to attempt to break free of this effect.

DC.Name: Pain Touch
DC.Description: Your attacks can twist the Ki in a living creature. Your strike disrupts the harmony within your opponent, rending them nauseated. A successful Fortitude save negates this effect.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Acolyte of Divine Secrets
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a Favored Soul. You have +2 to your Diplomacy skill and can call down the wrath of your former deity, producing an Avenging Light effect ten times per rest. (Activate this Favored Soul ability to cause a searing orb of radiant light to smite your target, dealing 1 to 8 hit points of light damage plus an additional 1 to 8 for every three caster levels past level 1.) D&D Dice: Deals 1d8 damage plus 1d8 additional per three caster levels.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Arcane Initiate
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a wizard. You have +1 to the DC's of spells you cast and can cast the magic missile spell ten times per rest, creating a missile of magical energy that darts forth and unerringly strikes its target inflicting 1d4+1 force damage. For every 2 caster levels beyond first you gain an additional missile, maximum 10 missiles. D&D Dice: Deals 1d4+1 force damage per missile (max 10 missiles)

Feat.Name: Past Life: Arcane Prodigy
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a sorcerer. Your maximum spell points are increased by 10 at first level and 5 spell points for each additional level and can produce random elemental damage spells ten times per rest. (Activate this sorcerer ability to blast a target with a ray of combined elements, doing 1 to 12 damage of a random elemental type plus an additional 1 to 12 per three caster levels on impact. A successful Reflex save reduces the damage by half.) D&D Dice: Deals 1d12 damage plus 1d12 damage additional per three caster levels.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Bardic Dilettante
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a bard. You have +1 to all Charisma based skills, +1 to the DC's of your Enchantment spells and can Inspire Courage three times per rest. (Activate this bard ability to rally your companions, giving them a +1 morale bonus to saves against fear effects and a +1 morale bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls before enhancements.)

Feat.Name: Past Life: Berserker's Fury
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a barbarian. You gain +20 hit points, have +2 to your Intimidate skill and can enter a barbarian rage one additional time per rest and enter a basic rage once per rest even if you do not have any other rage abilities. (Activate this barbarian ability to enter a bloodthirsty frenzy, granting you a +4 bonus to Strength and Constitution, a +2 Morale bonus to Will saves and a -2 penalty to AC. When the rage ends, however, you will lose the hit points granted to you by increased Constitution and become fatigued. Your rage will last for 30 seconds). This feat grants access to Racial and Class Toughness enhancements.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Delver of the Forbidden
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a Warlock. You gain +3 to your Spellcraft skill. You can confuse an enemy for 12 seconds (no saving throw). This can be used ten times per rest.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Disciple of the Fist
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a monk. You have +2 to your Concentration skill, deal increased unarmed damage (+0.5W), and can enter an evasive trance once per rest, granting the evasion feat for a short period of time (20sec). When you make a successful Reflex save to avoid damage, you suffer no damage instead of half damage. Note: You must meet normal evasion requirements for this one. No medium or heavy armor, no heavy encumbrance.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Harbinger of Nature's Wrath
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a druid. You have +2 to all elemental resistances and can cast the flame blade spell three times per rest, which summons a scimitar of fire that does fire damage instead of slashing damage and uses the wielder's Wisdom instead of Strength for determining attack and damage bonuses. You can choose to summon one or two scimitars and the swords are automatically equipped when created. At caster level 1, it has a +1 enhancement bonus and the flaming effect. Every five caster levels the summoned swords improve.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Initiate of the Faith
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a cleric. You have +2 to your Heal skill and can produce a Healing Word effect five times per rest. Positive energy is channeled to heal light wounds of your target or damage undead for 1 to 4 hit points plus an additional 1 to 4 per two caster levels. Undead who make a successful Will save reduce the damage by half. D&D Dice: Deals 1d4 damage plus 1d4 additional damage per two caster levels.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Sneak of Shadows
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a rogue. You have +1 to all skills and three times per rest you can skulk with the skill of your past life, gaining bonuses equal to your level to your hide and move silently skills, a +1 bonus to sneak attack damage plus an additional +1 per two character levels after first and a +1 bonus to hit with sneak attacks for every four levels.

Stance.Name: Sneak of Shadows
Stance.Description: Three times per rest you can skulk with the skill of your past life, gaining bonuses equal to your level to your hide and move silently skills, a +1 bonus to sneak attack damage plus an additional +1 per two character levels after first and a +1 bonus to hit with sneak attacks for every four levels.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Soldier of the Faith
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a paladin. You have +2 to your Heal skill and can invoke Divine Favor upon yourself three times per rest. (Activate this paladin ability to call upon the strength and wisdom of a deity to grant a +1 luck bonus on weapon attack and damage. This bonus is increased by +1 for every 3 caster levels beyond level 3, to a maximum of +3 at caster level 9.)

Feat.Name: Past Life: Student of Artifice
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as an artificer. When you use a rod, staff, or wand, you have a 15% chance to retain essence and not expend a charge and can produce an Enchant Armor or Enchant Weapons effect a total of ten times per rest. (Activate this artificer ability to increase the Enhancement Bonus of your target's currently equipped weapons or shields by 1, or to increase the Enhancement Bonus of your target's currently equipped armor by 1. An item can have only one temporary item enchantment at a time.)

Feat.Name: Past Life: Student of the Sword
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a fighter. You have +2 to your Intimidate skill, +1 to the Maximum Dexterity Bonus of armor and shields and can remember your martial prowess three times per rest, increasing your base attack bonus to your level and granting +4 to hit.

Feat.Name: Past Life: Warrior of the Wild
Feat.Description: You recall more about your past life as a ranger. You have +2 to your Spot skill and can produce a Barkskin effect three times per rest. (Activate this ranger ability to toughen the skin of an ally, giving a +2 natural armor bonus to AC with an additional +1 bonus for every 3 caster levels above 3rd, to a maximum of +5 at caster level 12th.)

Feat.Name: Path of Harmonious Balance: Fists of Light
Feat.Description: You have chosen to follow the path of light. You seek to be at harmony with the world and your training will reflect your philosophy. You can activate this ability to channel positive energy into your attack, dealing 4 to 24 additional damage against undead and applying a healing shield to your target which heals your allies that strike your target. On a vorpal strike (natural 20 followed by critical confirmation), you deal an additional 1 to 50 positive energy damage to undead. D&D Dice: Activate this ability to deal 4d6 additional damage to undead plus another 1d50 to undead on vorpal.

Feat.Name: Path of Inevitable Dominion: Fists of Darkness
Feat.Description: You have chosen to follow the path of darkness. You seek to dominate the world and your training will reflect your philosophy. You can activate this ability to channel negative energy into your attack, dealing 2 to 20 additional damage against living creatures and then rendering the target shaken. (A successful DC 10 + Monk Level + Wisdom Mod Will save negate the shaken effect.) On a vorpal strike (Natural 20 followed by critical confirmation), you deal an additional 1 to 50 negative energy damage. D&D Dice: Activate this ability to deal 2d10 additional damage to living creatures plus another 1d50 damage on vorpal.

DC.Name: Path of Inevitable Dominion: Fists of Darkness
DC.Description: You can activate this ability to channel negative energy into your attack, dealing 2 to 20 additional damage against living creatures and then rendering the target shaken.(A successful Will save negate the shaken effect.

Feat.Name: Perfect Self
Feat.Description: You have transcended your former race and are now considered a Lawful Outsider. You have gained damage reduction 10 / epic. Warforged retain most living construct traits.

Feat.Name: Point Blank Shot
Feat.Description: Grants a +1 bonus to hit within 15 meters and your ranged weapons deal +1[W]. This affects the base dice of the associated weapon any time they are rolled, including critical hits.

Feat.Name: Poison Save Bonus
Feat.Description: Dwarves are naturally resistant to poison, receiving a +2 bonus to saves against poisons.

Feat.Name: Power Attack
Feat.Description: Reduces your hit bonus by 5, or your Base Attack Bonus, whichever is lower. Then your successful attacks will have their damage increased by the same amount. Two-handed weapons get twice that damage bonus.

Stance.Name: Power Attack
Stance.Description: Reduces your hit bonus by 5, or your Base Attack Bonus, whichever is lower. Then your successful attacks will have their damage increased by the same amount. Two-handed weapons get twice that damage bonus.

Feat.Name: Power Critical
Feat.Description: Provides a +2 bonus to confirm critical hits and a +2 bonus to critical hit damage (before multipliers are applied).

Feat.Name: Precise Shot
Feat.Description: Your missile attacks may pass through other characters and monsters to strike their target. This feat also grants you the Offensive Ranged Stance 'Archer's Focus', which lets you deal progressively more damage with ranged attacks while standing still. +3 Ranged Power per stack, Max stacks: 15 or 25 wih Deepwood Stalker enhancement

Stance.Name: Archer's Focus
Stance.Description: Archer's Focus lets you deal progressively more damage with ranged attacks while standing still. +3 Ranged Power per stack, Max stacks: 15 or 25 wih Deepwood Stalker enhancement

Feat.Name: Precision
Feat.Description: While using Precision mode, you gain +5% to hit and reduces the target's fortification against your attacks by 25%.

Stance.Name: Precision
Stance.Description: While using Precision mode, you gain +5% to hit and reduces the target's fortification against your attacks by 25%.

Feat.Name: Purity of Body
Feat.Description: You have gained control over your body's immune system and are now unaffected by all natural diseases. (This has no effect on magical or supernatural diseases.)

Feat.Name: Quick Draw
Feat.Description: Allows the character to switch weapons and armor faster than they would normally be able to. It also increases the rate of fire of thrown weapons, but not of other ranged weapons.

Feat.Name: Quicken Spell
